Convenient location, great layout, not too crowded, good vibe with good music not too loud.  I had never been here before or gone rock climbing.  Note to people who haven't been to a Hanger 18 before....fill out the waivers online, it will save you a ton of time.  The employees were super helpful & nice.  I enjoyed my time there & will probably be back soon.
Still a beginner. Got a refresher course for belaying from Lina/Lynn (sorry, I'm really bad with names) and she rules. She made me feel comfortable and confident.

I have been wanting to try climbing for some time, but just haven't gotten around to it.  Lately I've been feeling kind of like a seize the moment mentality so things on my bucket list need to be crossed off...soon! So I got a friend of mine to come with me.  Staff is friendly, there was a young guy named Chris helping us out.  The electronic waiver system on the iPad was a little slow, freezing at some points so that was a little frustrating for my friend, but it worked for me.  Anyway, the lesson itself was helpful.  Chris was friendly, patient and made sure we knew what we were doing.  We got to climb the walls, alternate with our partners and do the belaying portion of it as well with supervision and assist as needed.  The scary part is leaning back and coming down for the first time.  It definitely is an exercise in trust.  The stupid or maybe naïve part for me is I came with my friend, who is about half of my size.  All fine and dandy, but when you're at the top of the wall for the first time and then told to let go, well the fear sets it.  I thought if I let go, then my friend will fly up.  Well she did nearly from our mistakes here and there.  But the instructor was close by, helping out as needed.  There are a variety of walls to try out, we were told which rocks are ideal for beginners and so forth.  There's also two stations with the Auto-Belay which is cool too.  Climbing is fun, coming down is a little harder and nerve-wracking for me.  But I climbed to the top with the Auto-Belay and let go and dropped.  Scary for a second, but it catches you and you come down.  I think once I did that, my fear was not as bad afterwards.  It is a very fun process, exhausting, but fun.  Staff is nice, the people all there (staff and fellow climbers) are nice and patient which helps.  A great start with a mellow atmosphere that makes it fun.  I will go back and practice some more.  A nice rush and a good workout.  Enjoy!

Great bouldering gym with challenging routes. I'm a novice climber so I'm still trying to get the "hang" of it but there are plenty of friendly people here who gives tips and advice. Great music selection too! The only downside is that it can get pretty hot with no ac.

Fresh Hanger 18. i like the feel of new unblasted holds at a new climbing gym. (then it becomes covered in other people's dead skin, nails, skin cells, and sweat)Your monthly pass or punch card works with this 4th location. For an area with some night life, wondering if this should be here. Hopefully this will make the more local Hanger 18 less crowded.

Omg! Omg!! OMG!! Why I waited so long beats me!!This place is fabulous!!Dale he helped me get started since im a newb and I was by myself got the membership since it was a cheaper way to go and free rental gear and free yoga classes I'm so game!This gym is very very clean pretty easy to get started with the auto belay....better to have a partner unless ur a pro you can go rope free (I think ur nuts but envy you) :-)Dale was just fabulous outstanding and just so sweet and freaking hilarious!!! I'm still cracking up...the rex trying to make a king size bed...I don't think ill ever forget that thanks dale!! You rock!! (HAha get it? Rock...)Anyways Brandon who was also there very nice as well!! Very good at multi tasking ty again for all ur help!!The prices are awesome and affordable if ur looking to try something different with an adrenaline rush!I was the only girl there so I kinda felt like an idiot compared to the other guys all rope free lol oh well I loved it and laughed and danced at myself once I reached the top which was my lil goal...Yelpers go and try this you'll feel like an idiot but amazing and self satisfaction!!Can't wait to go again and I'm dragging one of my friends with me since its free....I personally think instead of only one free pass should be at least five...five is a good number :-) just a recommendation...great rock gym!! Rock it up!

The recently revamped Hangar 18 gym is great for beginner climbers and those who want to learn rock climbing techniques. I especially love that it is not overwhelmingly expensive nor jam packed with people, like many other rock climbing gyms in the area where you have to wait in line to boulder for a few minutes and then leave it clear for the next person. The staff is very approachable and down to earth. I was able to practice some belaying with one of the instructors there and was very helpful in introducing me to different techniques and even sharing some climber slang!
Nice group of beginner bouldering routes and the MWF yoga classes are kicking my beginner butt!

Used the groupon to go on a date here. The staff was friendly and the environment was nice and open. Only 4 stars because you have to be trained to lift your own partner. Seems like a high risk and leaves room for an anxious climb. Also needs a water fountain. Other than that, an awesome environment and will return with a groupon!

The following gyms serve as my source of comparison when reviewing Hangar 18's top-rope area: UCI rock wall, Rockreation Costa Mesa, Hangar 18 South Bay, Mesa Rim San Diego, Planet Granite Sunnyvale, Rock City Anaheim.I came here last weekend and was pretty satisfied by the overall size, spaciousness, and cleanliness of the gym. They use Grigris and melons, which are not my favorite, but will work okay. My main complaint is that the holds were ridiculous. They are all these earthy tones that look almost like each other; I really pity anyone climbing here who cannot distinguish between brown, brown with the slightest green tint, and brown with a hint of yellow. Or maybe they would just assume those are the same colors and have an easier time climbing. it was frustrating constantly trying to figure out which holds were on, and what color I was looking at. The staff was really nice and helpful about it though. They explained that some of these holds were over 20-years-old, and that they were working on purchasing legit holds. Apparently this used to be a bouldering gym, so they would just use tape to indicate the routes...and now they were forced to make do with whatever "colors" they had. There were also some very interesting features here that I'd never encountered before, such as "plates" of fake-rock, and a wall of wavy looking rock features.The walls varied from very short to medium height...I'd say maybe 25 ft to 35 ft. The ratings at this gym, I felt, were incredibly inconsistent. At one area of the walls (the area with strange "plates" and earthy-colored holds), the routes were in general much easier than in the other area. I was able to complete almost all the 5.10s and 5.10bs I attempted on my first try, some with little difficulty. These ratings were probably on par with what I am used to. However, in the other area with newer holds, some of the routes were just ridiculous despite being 5.10as. They required some serious dyno-ing (over overhangs no less!), especially for someone of my stature (5'2''). I guess the route-setters were tall? Needless to say, these routes were...literally out-of-reach for me :)However, their Groupon (watch out for it) is a good deal, giving you 2 months of membership for slightly over $50, plus free classes and guests. I can't say that many rock gyms are so affordable.Verdict: Okay gym but the colors of the rocks nearly drove me mad. That coupled with some of the insane reachiness (worse than any other gym I've been too)...I will not be coming back often. Come here if you're tall and excellent at telling colors apart.

Lots of fun, lots to learn and lots to climb. This was,  I think, my fourth time here and I'm hooked. Such a good workout. Doing it by myself kinda sucks so I recommend going with friends. Cool atmosphere and overall some pretty nice people willing to give tips whenever you ask.

The facility is small compared to other, more established rock climbing facilities. The bouldering area was not very diverse, and often the routes are indistinguishable because the same color tape is used for paths that criss-cross. The strength training area in the rear looks like a scene at Average Joe's straight out of the movie Dodgeball. I have been an avid rock climber for more than 6 years in other cities and was hoping to call this place home after moving to Long Beach, but alas, I will not be a member of Hangar 18, after all.

This review is based on customer service.  This being the first and only climbing gym I've been too, I can say that the environment was not very welcoming.  Pretty much every time I entered the gym, there was no basic acknowledgement or greeting.  Unfriendly and indifferent.  The people behind the counter are young.They would basically just sit behind the counter and stare at the computer in front of them.  I can only imagine that they're checking their email or surfing the web?  Would not throw down money for a membership here.

Love this place, went here for my first time climbing and Brandon was a very nice and helpful instructor. Weekdays before 6 pm are best, and college students get a discount with school ID for monthly memberships.

I took advantage of the Summer Sale paying $5 for the first month, thereafter it's $33 a month. This is the best deal you'll find in OC/LA area. Plus there are several other locations. I alternate going here and Mission Viejo since I live in the middle. This may not be the best place for a beginner boulderer but there's a lot of options for top rope beginners and 2 auto belays. I really don't understand why some people give this place 3 stars or less. Yes it may not be Ikea catalog looking, especially with all the plastic fold up tables. But so what? The low price makes up for it, which include shoes, harness and McGregor belay device. Plus you can get a belay lesson anytime, provided that you have a partner. I came her on my own and found someone who was willing to be my partner. They don't let you belay with an ATC but they will lend you a McGregor. I took off one star only because they don't have enough V0 grade in their boulder area. Highly recommend, but it may be daunting for a beginner.
First time going had alot of fun. Recommendation is to go during the weekday if you can. No kids what so ever. Brandon taught us everything we needed to know. Super fun.

Used to be The Rock Gym, but got bought out by Hanger 18 as their second gym. I came here before they got bought and my experiences was poor. At the time I was still a pretty new climber doing v2 at rock city. Came here couldn't climb anything! This place is big, nice and clean, but the routes are just too crazy! Not worth it, but I'll try it one more time because of new management?

The only reason I didn't give this place five stars was because only one person was helping guests while 4 other employees stood around doing I'm not sure what.  Dale was AMAZING!! Super friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful.  He was doing everything, helping us, other customers, doing computer work, while the other four guys just stood around and talked..made me feel bad but I wanted to write the review to recognize Dale (I'm pretty sure that was his name..haha he said it fast)--I would definitely give him five stars!! The place itself was fun, I went on a Wednesday so there weren't many people there and you get to do your own thing--fun place to try out indoor rock climbing and be left alone to do your own thing!

Came on a weekday afternoon to avoid the crowds. Dale is the one man show. My nine year old is ready to give up gymnastics for this. Place has a slightly better vibe and layout than the Hawthorne location.

Got a groupon for two intro classes - awesome starter gym. The guy at the desk gave us a quick but thorough tutorial and off we went. It was crowded initially but calmed down after 8 pm. But that might also be because the groupon was expiring. Would def recommend!

I'm not a huge climber, and that's also what makes this place awesome.  It's very welcoming to inexperienced climbers, and also seems to be a favorite with those with more experience as well.  I've been back about 4 times over the past few years, and have seen staff that have been there the whole time as well as staff that is new.  The constant is they are always friendly and always helpful! As I said, if you aren't very inexperienced the staff will help get you started, and there are some easy routes to try out.  I also routinely see a guy or two who are really intense- doing dino routes and sparsely- populated walls. It's a really relaxed environment- not too crowded, and you can usually get the walls you want when you want them.  Also a very fair price- there's nothing really to complain about here.  Climbing is a fun, physical activity that can break up the monotony of other activities, I would definitely recommend finding your way here!

First time we went, the employee Tom made us waiting around after we finished signing the waivers for 20+min and still didn't tend to us so we ended up leaving. But called Hangar 18 and Brandon very politely said we could come back and climb anytime. Second time we went, the employee walked us through the whole way and informed us about the 4 checks. As a beginner, it was kind of a difficult course but we managed to get to the top.
Great rock gym...with varying levels of difficulty. Fun time and great exercise!

Pretty cool gym. Really nice employees. Walls are a little short. The lead walls looked pretty fun but I didn't have a chance to climb any. The route ratings seemed generous but there is good diversity and the routes are fun! Overall I would definitely recommend it to anyone.
